docs.snippet: Community leaders said the search for a man who fatally stabbed a 6-year-old boy and critically wounded a 7-year-old girl was being complicated by a lack of video surveillance....
docs.lead_paragraph: Community leaders said the search for a man who fatally stabbed a 6-year-old boy and critically wounded a 7-year-old girl was being complicated by a lack of video surveillance.
docs.abstract: Brooklyn community leaders say search for a man who fatally stabbed 6-year-old Prince Joshua Avitto and critically wounded 7-year-old Mikayla Capers in Boulevard Houses public housing project is being made more difficult because building has no surveillance cameras; many public housing projects across New York City do not have surveillance cameras, despite more than $60 million that city has allocated for them over past few years.

headline.main: After Boy and Girl Are Stabbed, Anger Over a Lack of Cameras
headline.print_headline: After Boy and Girl Are Stabbed, Anger Over a Lack of Cameras
